title: Fourth Amendment Victory: Michigan Supreme Court Reins in Digital Device Fishing Expeditions
summary: The Michigan Supreme Court has delivered a significant ruling strengthening Fourth Amendment protections against unreasonable searches and seizures, particularly concerning digital devices. The court held that law enforcement must specify the scope of their search warrants when investigating digital devices, such as smartphones and laptops, to prevent broad and invasive "fishing expeditions." This decision stems from a case where a warrant intended for specific digital evidence allowed a more expansive search than appropriate, infringing on privacy rights.
